qas.question: When did wars between Britain and France in North America start?
What was the most important North American conflict between France and Britain called?
What French colony did Great Britain conquer in Queen Anne's War?
When was the final French and Indian War fought?
What future American founding father fought in the French and Indian War?
When did wars between China and France in North America start?
What was the most important South American conflict between France and Britain called?
What French colony did Great Britain conquer outside of Queen Anne's War?
When was the first French and Indian War fought?
What future Canadian founding father fought in the French and Indian War?

context: Beginning in <a0_0><b5_0>1689<b5_0/><a0_0/>, the colonies became involved in a series of wars between Great Britain and France for control of North America, the most important of which were <a1_0><b6_0>Queen Anne's War<a1_0/>,<b6_0/> in which the British conquered French colony <a2_0><b7_0>Acadia<b7_0/><a2_0/>, and the final French and Indian War (<a3_0><b8_0>1754–63<b8_0/><a3_0/>) when Britain was victorious over all the French colonies in North America. This final war was to give thousands of colonists, including Virginia colonel <a4_0><b9_0>George Washington<b9_0/><a4_0/>, military experience which they put to use during the American Revolutionary War.
